bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton, August 5, 1889
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, August 5th, 1889
Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, August 5th, 1889
Honorable William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State, Wasington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor respectfully to acknowledge the receipt of your circulars of April 27th, June 8th, 10th, 22nd, and 27th 1889. All of which reached this office on the 2nd inst.
Information, in compliance with the instruction contianed in the last mentioned, is now being gathered, which will be transmitted as early as possible
I have the honor to be, sir, your obedient Servant, Ezekiel E. Smith U.S. Consul General
